titleStmt.title: You tides with ceaseless swell and ebb
a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: This manuscript is a draft of the poem, "You Tides With Ceaseless Swell." Writing on the verso (which is made up of fragments of several letters, dated between 1871â€“1884) indicates that the manuscript was probably created sometime in or after 1884. "You Tides With Ceaseless Swell" is one of eight poems in the "Fancies at Navesink" sequence, which first appeared in print in the August 1885 issue of Nineteenth Century.

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: You Tides with Ceaseless Swell and Ebb
bibl.idno: No call number, box, or folder listed.
bibl.orgName: Walt Whitman Poetry Manuscripts at The Walt Whitman House in Camden
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

The prose drafted on the back of these and several other related manuscript leaves includes ideas and phrases that resemble those used in "Unnamed Lands," a poem published first in the 1860 edition of Leaves of Grass.

head.hi:
You tides with ceaseless swell
and ebb

lg.l:
You tides with ceaseless swell and
ebb! you lawpower that does this work!

You unseenunseen force, centripetal, centrifugal,
through spaces spreadentire, ! to you systole
diastole!

WhatHow ‸you intermutual unseen chains of
sun, and moon, and earth and
all the brother worlds of space? myriad stars?constellations!

What message by you it from
distant worlds to us!? What
Sirius'? What Capella's?
